t: Jeremiah 10
Hear*p ye the word which the Lord*s speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:
Thus*p saith the Lord,*s Learn not the way of the heathen, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the heathen are dismayed at them.
For*p the customs of the people are vain: for one cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman, with the axe.
They*p deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.
They*p are upright as the palm tree, but speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither also is it in them to do good.
Forasmuch*p as there is none like unto thee, O Lord;*s thou art great, and thy name is great in might.
Who*p would not fear thee, O King of nations? for to thee doth it appertain: forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is none like unto thee.
But*p they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock is a doctrine of vanities.

Silver*p spread into plates is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the workman, and of the hands of the founder: blue and purple is their clothing: they are all the work of cunning men.
But*p the Lord*s is the true God, he is the living God, and an everlasting king: at his wrath the earth shall tremble, and the nations shall not be able to abide his indignation.
Thus*p shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, even they shall perish from the earth, and from under these heavens.
He*p hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.

When*p he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.
Every*p man is brutish in his knowledge: every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
They*p are vanity, and the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
The*p portion of Jacob is not like them: for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: The Lord*s of hosts is his name.
Gather*p up thy wares out of the land, O inhabitant of the fortress.
For*p thus saith the Lord,*s Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this once, and will distress them, that they may find it so.
Woe*p is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this is a grief, and I must bear it.
My*p tabernacle is spoiled, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth of me, and they are not: there is none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.
For*p the pastors are become brutish, and have not sought the Lord:*s therefore they shall not prosper, and all their flocks shall be scattered.
Behold,*p the noise of the bruit is come, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, and a den of dragons.
O*p Lord,*s I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.
O*p Lord,*s correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.

Pour*p out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name: for they have eaten up Jacob, and devoured him, and consumed him, and have made his habitation desolate.
